results.title: Clear across Australia
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advances being made in telecommunications in Australia. A microwave radio repeater system now joins the systems of Eastern and Western Australia. Shows the phases of construction and the benefits of this system which is vital to our communications network.

results.title: Cleanliness and health
results.brief_description: Micro-photography is used to show the existence of micro-organisms and how these may be controlled. The film explains how these organisms are responsible for disease and how to avoid such diseases. Careful attention must be paid to the rules of cleanliness.
results.description: Micro-photography is used to show the existence of micro-organisms and how these may be controlled. The film explains how these organisms are responsible for disease and how to avoid such diseases. Careful attention must be paid to the rules of cleanliness.

results.title: Clean up your act
results.brief_description: Encourages children to be aware of the danger inherent in slovenly habits in the kitchen, in care of their clothing, and in personal hygiene.

results.title: Clean milk
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson and Great Britain. Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: A film for dairy farmers, pointing out that simple precautions (such as ensuring that milk cans waiting for delivery to the factory are shaded), should be carried out by dairy farmers in their own interests. For if milk consumption does not reach the public in the best possible condition, the Government will be obliged to legislate in such a way that farmers will be forced to carry out these same precautions.

results.title: Clean and bright
results.brief_description: The need for cleanliness in both man and animals is illustrated using Mr Williams and his pet elephant, Maxwell. Mr Williams has provided all the necessities of life for Maxwell, except for a bath. Also shows animals and children cleaning themselves in various ways and provides a solution to Maxwell’s problem.

results.title: Claymation: three dimensional clay animation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton, Susan Shadburne, Pyramid Films and Will Vinton Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the principles and processes of three dimensional clay animation. Shows the mixing of colour, creation of characters that move, production and editing of the live action film which serves as an animation guide, music scoring and the slow demanding process of working with the clay itself. Includes scenes from “Closed Monday” and “Martin the Cobbler”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Will Vinton, Susan Shadburne, Pyramid Films and Will Vinton Productions

results.title: Claycraft at Denby
results.brief_description: The Denby Potteries were founded in 1809. This film shot at these Potteries, covers the manufacture from start to finish of English kitchenware (teapots, casserole dishes, etc), ending with a tour of the Potteries’ new showrooms, where the articles displayed show the modern trend of design in everyday ware.

results.title: Clay: or the origin of the species
results.creator_credit: Eliot Noyes, Contemporary Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: An art film in which three-dimensional forms of modelling clay are used to express a visual and amusing variation on a theory of evolution as suggested by the simple lifeforms which emerge from graphic motions of a clay sea. Best Film, 6th Annual Annecy film festival.
results.title_for_label: Clay: or the origin of the species

results.title: Clay in action
results.brief_description: Step-by-step demonstrations of a sculptor modelling a head in clay. Shows how he packs clay on wooden supports; the first rough carving; measuring the model with calipers and cutting the measurements into the clay, carving out the larger primary, carving out minor planes; using the thumbs to blend, model and smooth; finishing.
